purpose.p: Creates a named element node and writes it to the result tree.

usage.p: Because the name attribute is an attribute value template, it is suitable for the generation of a element when the name is not known until runtime.
When multiple namespaces are being used you can use the namespace to give the correct URI, without worrying about multiple prefixes getting copied to the output unnecessarily.

property.name: name
property.description: The name of the element to create

property.name: namespace
property.description: The namespace URI of the element

property.name: inherit-namespaces
property.description: Whether or not children of a copied node will inherit copied namespaces

property.name: use-attribute-sets
property.description: The space-separated list of attribute set names to use for this element
